author: Niki Koswanage, Tom Redmond, Vicky Kaiyi Feng
description: Altantuya Shaariibuu was killed by two bodyguards of top officials including the former Malaysian prime minister. Her father says it would be “insane” to allow the jailed politician to stage a political comeback.
title: Najib Comeback Would Be ‘Insane,’ Murdered Mongolian’s Dad Says

author: Molly Smith
description: President Donald Trump named EJ Antoni, chief economist of the conservative Heritage Foundation, to lead the Bureau of Labor Statistics after firing the former head of the agency earlier this month.
title: Trump Names Heritage’s EJ Antoni to Lead Bureau of Labor Statistics

author: Michael O'Boyle, Todd Gillespie
description: Citigroup Inc. Chief Executive Officer Jane Fraser is in Mexico City for talks with President Claudia Sheinbaum that include the potential public listing of her bank’s retail unit Banamex, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Citi CEO Visits Mexico President During Banamex Stake Talks

author: Daniel Flatley, Erik Schatzker
description: The US Treasury secretary has the ear of an impulsive president — and nervous investors worldwide hope it stays that way. An exclusive interview.
title: Bessent on Tariffs, Deficits and Embracing Trump’s Economic Plan

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Deal for Chip Revenue May Usher In Trade Policy Shift

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: President Donald Trump’s tax and spending law will deal a financial blow to the poorest Americans while boosting the income of wealthier households, according to a new analysis from the Congressional Budget Office.
title: Trump Tax Law Squeezes Poor, Boosts Income for Wealthy, CBO Says

author: Matthew Bristow
description: Two days before a teenage assassin shot him in the head, presidential candidate Miguel Uribe Turbay warned that Colombia’s radical peace plan was empowering violent criminals and plunging the country into chaos.
title: Colombian Senator’s Murder Threatens Petro’s Radical Peace Plan

author: Jenny Leonard, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump is extending a tariff truce with China for another 90 days, stabilizing trade ties between the world’s two largest economies.
title: Trump Extends China Tariff Truce for 90 Days, CNBC Says

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Yvonne Yue Li
description: President Donald Trump said Monday imports of gold will not face US tariffs, weighing in after a federal ruling caused chaos and confusion in global bullion markets.
title: Trump Says Gold Imports Won’t Be Tariffed in Reprieve for Market

author: Beatriz Reis
description: Brazil Finance Minister Fernando Haddad said in a local television interview on Monday that a planned meeting with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent was canceled and there’s no new date for the encounter.
title: Brazil’s Haddad Says Meeting With Scott Bessent Was Canceled

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Kateryna Chursina
description: Russia’s war in Ukraine is well into its fourth year, despite US President Donald Trump’s promise to end the conflict within 24 hours of his return to office.
title: The Territory at the Heart of Russia’s War in Ukraine

author: S'thembile Cele, Ntando Thukwana
description: South Africa’s second-biggest party reiterated its intention to remain within the fractious coalition government, saying its continued participation had the backing of most of its members and should boost its support in next year’s municipal elections.
title: South Africa’s DA Sees Ruling Coalition Weathering Latest Rift

author: Patricia Xavier
description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will meet with Vice President Geraldo Alckmin at 5pm in Brasilia to discuss a raft of measures to support for sectors hit by the 50% tariffs from the US, newspaper Estado of Sao Paulo reported. That contingency plan will take priority in Congress, Hugo Motta, the speaker of the lower house, told CNN Brasil. Similarly, Senate President Davi Alcolumbre has signaled that his chamber will fast track the measures. The idea is that they will be approved this
title: Brazil Prioritizes Economic Aid to Counter 50% US Tariffs Impact

author: Ani Avetisyan
description: Armenia and Azerbaijan released the text of a peace declaration signed at the White House as the Armenian premier sought to sell regional powers Russia and Iran on the accord.
title: Armenia, Azerbaijan Unveil Peace Deal Text Signed in Washington

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Josh Wingrove, Natalia Drozdiak
description: President Donald Trump downplayed expectations for his upcoming meeting with Russian leader Vladimir Putin as he seeks to end the war in Ukraine, casting it as a “feel-out meeting” and saying he would confer with Ukrainian and European leaders after the sitdown.
title: Trump Downplays Expectations for Summit Deal With Putin

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said Monday he is considering whether to reclassify marijuana as a less dangerous drug and would decide in “the next few weeks.”
title: Trump Says Decision on Marijuana Classification Coming in Weeks

author: Galit Altstein
description: An attempt by Israeli hostage families to organize a nationwide strike against plans for a military takeover of Gaza was dealt a blow on Monday, when the country’s main labor union declined to join in.
title: Israel’s Biggest Labor Union Declines to Join General Strike

author: Andras Gergely
description: Barclays Plc said the forint could gain as much as 5.5% should Hungary’s opposition beat the Fidesz party of Prime Minister Viktor Orban in next year’s election.
title: Barclays Sees Substantial Forint Gain If Orban Loses 2026 Vote

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A US appeals court ordered the Trump administration to resume publicly sharing data on how it is spending federal dollars, blasting the government for suddenly refusing to follow a law that requires transparency.
title: Trump Administration Rejected by Court in Spending Data Fight

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump announced he would take control of Washington DC’s Metropolitan Police Department and deploy the National Guard as part of a push to reduce crime and homelessness in the nation’s capital.
title: Trump Deploys National Guard to DC, Takes Control of Police

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: Intel Corp. Chief Executive officer Lip-Bu Tan is expected to meet with US President Donald Trump, four days after Trump called for Tan’s resignation and accused him of having conflicts of interest.
title: Intel CEO to Meet Trump After President’s Call for Resignation

author: Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s top ally urged swift prosecution of Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu and other opposition mayors, signaling a push to quickly resolve high-profile cases that have heightened political tensions and unsettled Turkey’s markets.
title: Erdogan Ally Calls for Swift Trials of Turkish Opposition Mayors

author: Dan Strumpf
description: India is committed to strengthening ties with Ukraine, while calling for a peaceful resolution to its war with Russia, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said in a post on X on Monday after a conversation with President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
title: Modi Says India Committed to Strengthening Ties With Ukraine

author: Ari Altstedter
description: The private Florida community of Windsor is less than a two-hour drive from Donald Trump’s Mar-a-Lago, yet worlds away in terms of vibes.
title: Canadians Furious About Trump Flee Their Private Florida Community

author: Eliyahu Kamisher
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom urged President Donald Trump to call on the Texas governor and leaders of other Republican-led states to halt efforts to redraw congressional maps, saying the most populous US state will stand down if they do.
title: Newsom Says He’ll Halt State Redistricting If Trump Backs Down

author: Bob Van Voris, Madlin Mekelburg, Alicia A. Caldwell
description: The Trump administration and California will face off in court Monday,  over President Donald Trump’s decision to deploy the National Guard and Marines in Los Angeles.
title: Trump and Newsom Face Off in Trial Over National Guard in LA

author: Arne Delfs
description: European leaders and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will hold a call with Donald Trump on Wednesday ahead of the US president’s meeting Friday in Alaska with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin.
title: European Leaders, Zelenskiy to Speak With Trump on Wednesday

author: Bob Van Voris
description: A federal judge in New York denied a request by the Trump administration to release sealed transcripts in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, the former girlfriend and associate of Jeffrey Epstein.
title: Ghislaine Maxwell Grand Jury Transcript Release Denied by Judge

author: Andra Timu, Irina Vilcu
description: Romania’s two-months old ruling alliance was rocked by a conflict over an austerity drive, prompting the largest party to say it will boycott future coalition meetings.
title: Romanian Top Ruling Party Pressures Coalition on Funding Dispute

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Russia’s Saratov refinery, owned by Rosneft PJSC, has stopped oil intake following a drone attack on Sunday, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Rosneft’s Refinery in Volga Region Halts Oil Intake After Attack

author: Sanne Wass, Christian Wienberg
description: Denmark’s plan to inject billions of dollars into Orsted A/S has sparked political backlash at a time when taxpayers are already spending more on defense and the fiscal bonanza from drug giant Novo Nordisk A/S is fading.
title: Denmark’s Plan To Inject Billions Into Orsted Sparks Political Backlash

author: Patricia Laya
description: Senator Miguel Uribe Turbay, a Colombian presidential hopeful who had warned that the nation was slipping back into its violent past, has died two months after being gunned down while campaigning in Bogotá. He was 39.
title: Colombia Presidential Hopeful Uribe Dies After June Shooting

description: BOGOTA, Colombia (AP) — Colombian conservative senator and presidential hopeful Miguel Uribe Turbay died Monday, more than two months after being shot during a campaign rally in western Bogota.
title: Colombia Presidential Candidate Miguel Uribe Has Died

author: Jane Lanhee Lee, Yian Lee
description: Restarting Taiwan’s mothballed nuclear power plants is one of the key things the self-governed island should do to bolster its energy security against threats from China, according to a former deputy US national security adviser and a retired American admiral.
title: Taiwan’s Energy Security Needs Nuclear, Ex-US Officials Say

author: Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesia has created more than 20 regional commands in its biggest armed forces overhaul in decades, coinciding with a sharp increase in defense spending under President Prabowo Subianto and mounting concerns over growing military influence.
title: Indonesia Expands Military as Defense Budget Soars

author: Anthony Halpin
description: European leaders want to speak to Trump before he meets with Putin.
title: Putin May Feel at Home With Trump in Alaska

author: Katia Dmitrieva, Philip Heijmans
description: Even in an administration that has repeatedly pushed the legal limits of using economic statecraft to reshape the global business landscape, a new deal with two tech giants is raising alarm bells among trade experts.
title: Trump Bid for Cut of Nvidia, AMD Revenue Risks ‘Dangerous World’

author: Tooba Khan
description: Pakistan’s army chief accused India of continuing to fuel instability in the region and warned it was fully prepared to counter any aggression from New Delhi as tensions between the two rivals remain high following a four-day armed conflict in May.
title: Pakistan Army Chief Warns It Will Counter Any India Aggression

author: Sam Dagher
description: A number of Western countries including the UK and US have issued security alerts over the weekend for their citizens living in or traveling to the United Arab Emirates, warning about threats of attacks against sites in the Gulf nation associated with Israel and Jewish people.
title: US, UK Warn of Attacks in UAE on Places Associated with Israel

author: Candido Mendes
description: Angolan President João Lourenço will meet top advisers on Monday to discuss the threat of renewed protests over steep increases in fuel prices this year.
title: Angola's President Tries Stem Threat of New Protests Over Surging Fuel Prices

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Nguyen Dieu Tu Uyen
description: Top leaders of South Korea and Vietnam agreed to step up efforts to nearly double their bilateral trade to $150 billion annually by 2030, as the two Asian export powerhouses seek to mitigate the impact from Donald Trump’s tariffs.
title: South Korea, Vietnam Eye Doubling Trade to $150 Billion by 2030

author: Kamran Haider
description: Pakistan and US officials are currently in discussions to finalize finer details of their trade deal that includes investments after securing the lowest tariff among major South Asian nations, according to Pakistan’s state finance minister.
title: Pakistan, US Continue Discussions for Investment, Trade Deals

author: Daniel Basteiro, Ben Sills
description: A political storm that erupted when José Luis Escrivá became Bank of Spain chief last September is still raging a year later after a series of high-profile exits under his watch.
title: Bank of Spain’s Political Storm Rages On With Officials Exiting

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright, Harumi Ichikura
description: Switzerland’s economy will prove resilient enough to largely shake off the shock of US tariffs over the next year or so, according to a Bloomberg survey of economists.
title: Switzerland’s Tariff Shock Is Seen Barely Hurting Growth for Now

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Heesu Lee
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung will be testing the limits of one of the more successful strategies of dealing with US President Donald Trump when he visits the White House this month.
title: South Korea’s Winning Trump Strategy Faces Moment of Truth

author: Hallie Gu, Ben Westcott
description: US President Donald Trump said he hoped China massively stepped up its purchases of American soybeans — comments that come a day before a trade truce expires.
title: Trump Urges China to Buy More Soybeans as Truce Deadline Looms

author: Matthew Brockett
description: The New Zealand government said it is considering recognition of a state of Palestine, with a formal decision to be taken in September.
title: New Zealand Government to Consider Recognizing Palestinian State

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: A Chinese ship targeted a Philippine vessel with water cannon near a disputed shoal in the South China Sea, in an escalation of tensions after Beijing protested Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.’s remarks over Taiwan.
title: Philippines Says China Ship Targeted Vessel With Water Cannon

author: Swati Pandey
description: Australia will formally recognize a Palestinian state at the United Nations summit in September, breaking with close ally the US as concern mounts over Israel’s plans for a renewed military campaign in parts of the Gaza Strip.
title: Australia Plans to Recognize a Palestinian State, Albanese Says
